parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.0
Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.0

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor element for field EX.STUDYID

fields.definition: A unique identifier for a study.
fields.implementationNotes: While this field is not typically captured on a CRF, it should be displayed clearly on the CRF and/or the EDC system. This field can be included into the database or populated during SDTM-based dataset creation before submission.
fields.label: Study Identifier
fields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading "SDTMIG Target".
fields.name: STUDYID
fields.questionText: What is the study identifier?

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.0

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor element for field EX.SITEID

fields.definition: A unique identifier for a site within a study.
fields.implementationNotes: Paper: This is typically preprinted in the header of each CRF page for single site studies. For studies with multiple sites, this field may be left blank so that the number can be recorded by the site, or it may be preprinted for the CRFs that are shipped to each site. EDC: This should be prepopulated.
fields.label: Study Site Identifier
fields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading "SDTMIG Target".
fields.name: SITEID
fields.questionText: What is the site identifier?

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.0

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor element for field EX.SUBJID

fields.completionInstructions: Record the identifier for the subject.
fields.definition: A unique subject identifier within a site and a study.
fields.implementationNotes: Paper: This is typically recorded in the header of each CRF page. EDC: The subject identifiers may be provided to the site using a pre-populated list in the system. This CDASH variable is typically collected in all CDASH domains. However, this CDASH variable is populated only in the SDTMIG DM domain. For more information, refer to Study Data Tabulation Model.
fields.label: Subject Identifier for the Study
fields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading "SDTMIG Target".
fields.name: SUBJID
fields.questionText: What is the subject identifier?

codelist.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for codelist C99079

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.0

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor element for field EX.EPOCH

fields.completionInstructions: [protocol specific]
fields.definition: Name of the Trial Epoch with which this Element of the Arm is associated.
fields.implementationNotes: If the same information is collected more than once in different periods/parts of a study (e.g., Disposition), EPOCH may be needed to differentiate them. Typically, the trial epoch will be pre-printed on the CRF as the title of the page. See SDTMIG for further information regarding EPOCH.
fields.label: Epoch
fields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading "SDTMIG Target".
fields.name: EPOCH
fields.questionText: What is the trial period?

codelist.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for codelist C66742

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.0

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor element for field EX.EXYN

fields.completionInstructions: Indicate if the subject took any medications. If Yes, include the appropriate details where indicated.
fields.definition: An indication whether or not the subject took study medication/treatment.
fields.implementationNotes: The intent/purpose of collecting this field is to help with data cleaning and monitoring. It provides verification that all other fields on the CRF were deliberately left blank. The EXYN variable is a cleaning or EDC convention meant to indicate that the exposure as collected form should be completed or inserted into the case book. EXOCCUR would be used when the actual drug name is preprinted on the CRF. While these might be equivalent in a single drug study, there are differences in how they would be used in most trials. Therefore, it does not map into the SDTM variable EXOCCUR, since EXOCCUR indicates whether the subject was actually administered treatment/medication. If actual treatment data is available (EXYN = "Y"), ECOCCUR may be populated based on whether subject was actually administered treatment/medication.
fields.label: Any Study Treatment Taken
fields.mappingInstructions: Does not map to an SDTMIG variable. The SDTM Annotated CRF is annotated to indicate that this field is NOT SUBMITTED.
fields.name: EXYN
fields.questionText: Were any study treatments taken?

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.0

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor element for field EX.EXCAT

fields.completionInstructions: Record the study treatment category, if not pre-printed on the CRF.
fields.definition: A grouping of topic-variable values based on user defined characteristics.
fields.implementationNotes: Sponsor-defined Controlled Terminology. This would most commonly be either a heading, or a pre-printed category value on the CRF and not a question to which the site would provide an answer. If a question is asked, the response would typically be a sponsor-defined codelist. If the form is laid out as a grid, then words such as "Category" can be included as the column header.
fields.label: Category of Treatment
fields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading "SDTMIG Target".
fields.name: EXCAT
fields.questionText: What is the category of the study treatment?

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.0

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor element for field EX.EXSCAT

fields.completionInstructions: Record the study treatment subcategory, if not pre-printed on the CRF.
fields.definition: A sub-division of the EXCAT values based on user defined characteristics.
fields.implementationNotes: Sponsor-defined Controlled Terminology. This would most commonly be pre-printed on the CRF or screen and pre-populated in the data management system. This is not typically a question to which the site would provide an answer. EXSCAT can only be used if there is an EXCAT and it must be a subcategorization of EXCAT.
fields.label: Subcategory of Treatment
fields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading "SDTMIG Target".
fields.name: EXSCAT
fields.questionText: What is the subcategory of the study treatment?

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.0

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor element for field EX.EXTRT

fields.completionInstructions: Record the name of study treatment.
fields.definition: Name of the study treatment or intervention given per single administration or during the "constant dosing interval" for the observation.
fields.implementationNotes: EXTRT captures the name of the investigational treatment. This is typically collected for open label studies and populated for blinded studies during the SDTM-based dataset creation. Since EXTRT is the SDTMIG topic variable, it is a required variable in SDTM and must have a value in CDASH or a plan to populate it in the SDTM submission datasets (i.e. collected or populated from other sources).
fields.label: Treatment Name
fields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading "SDTMIG Target".
fields.name: EXTRT
fields.questionText: What was the study treatment?

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.0

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor element for field EX.EXREFID

fields.completionInstructions: Record treatment label identifier.
fields.definition: An internal or external identifier such as kit number, bottle label, vial identifier.
fields.implementationNotes: This packaging identifier (e.g. kit number, bottle label, vial identifier) may be collected in different ways (e.g. affixing label onto CRF or scanning a bar code). For some study dosing regimens, greater granularity for treatment identifiers may be needed
fields.label: Exposure Reference ID
fields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading "SDTMIG Target".
fields.name: EXREFID
fields.questionText: What is the study treatment label identifier?

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.0

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor element for field EX.EXLOT

fields.completionInstructions: Record the lot number that appears on the container holding the study treatment.
fields.definition: Lot Number of the EXTRT product.
fields.implementationNotes: The Lot Number identifies the manufacturing batch of the study treatment. In open label studies, the reference number on the study treatment container may represent an actual Lot Number and is submitted using EXLOT. This variable may be populated during the process of creating the SDTM submission datasets. Do not collect other identification variables in this field.
fields.label: Lot Number
fields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading "SDTMIG Target".
fields.name: EXLOT
fields.questionText: What was the lot number of the study treatment used?

codelist.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for codelist C66742

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.0

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor element for field EX.EXFAST

fields.completionInstructions: Record whether the subject was fasting prior to the study treatment being taken.
fields.definition: An indication that the subject has abstained from food/water for the specified amount of time.
fields.implementationNotes: Some study treatments may have a food effect and it is important to know whether the dose was taken while the subject was fasted.
fields.label: Exposure Fasting Status
fields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading "SDTMIG Target".
fields.name: EXFAST
fields.questionText: Was the subject fasting?

codelist.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for codelist C66726
Version-agnostic anchor resource for codelist C78426

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.0

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor element for field EX.EXDOSFRM

fields.completionInstructions: Record the dose form (e.g., SOLUTION, TABLET, LOTION) or enter the appropriate code from the code list.
fields.definition: The dosage form in which the EXTRT is physically presented.
fields.implementationNotes: This must be collected if it cannot be determined from other sources or if there are multiple options.
fields.label: Exposure Dose Form
fields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading "SDTMIG Target".
fields.name: EXDOSFRM
fields.questionText: What was the dose form of the study treatment?

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.0

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor element for field EX.EXSTDAT

fields.completionInstructions: Record the start date of the study treatment administration using this format (DD-MON-YYYY).
fields.definition: The [start] date of study treatment represented in an unambiguous date format (e.g., DD-MON-YYYY).
fields.implementationNotes: Date when constant dosing interval of the study treatment started or single administration occurred. When collecting the date for an individual dose, the word "start" may be omitted from the Question Text and Prompt.
fields.label: Exposure Start Date
fields.mappingInstructions: This does not map directly to an SDTMIG variable. For the SDTM submission dataset, concatenate all collected CDASH START DATE and TIME components and populate the SDTMIG variable EXSTDTC in ISO 8601 format.
fields.name: EXSTDAT
fields.questionText: What was the [intended/actual] [study treatment/dose] [start] date?

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.0

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor element for field EX.EXSTTIM

fields.completionInstructions: Record the start time (as complete as possible) when administration of study treatment started.
fields.definition: The [start] time of the study treatment represented in an unambiguous time format (e.g., hh:mm:ss).
fields.implementationNotes: Recommend collecting the time a medication was started only when a protocol or data collection scenarios requires it.
fields.label: Exposure Start Time
fields.mappingInstructions: This does not map directly to an SDTMIG variable. For the SDTM submission dataset, concatenate all collected CDASH START DATE and TIME components and populate the SDTMIG variable EXSTDTC in ISO 8601 format.
fields.name: EXSTTIM
fields.questionText: What was the [intended/actual] [study treatment/dose] (start) time?

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.0

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor element for field EX.EXENDAT

fields.completionInstructions: Record the end date or last date of administration of study treatment using this format (DD-MON-YYYY).
fields.definition: The end date of study treatment represented in an unambiguous date format (e.g., DD-MON-YYYY).
fields.implementationNotes: If start date and end date are not expected to be on the same date, the end date is required. If the study design indicates that the start and end date are on the same day, the end date is not required since it can be assigned to be equal to the start date.
fields.label: Exposure End Date
fields.mappingInstructions: This does not map directly to an SDTMIG variable. For the SDTM submission dataset, concatenate all collected CDASH END DATE and TIME components and populate the SDTMIG variable EXENDTC in ISO 8601 format.
fields.name: EXENDAT
fields.questionText: What was the [intended/actual] [treatment/dose] [end] date?

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.0

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor element for field EX.EXENTIM

fields.completionInstructions: Record the time, (as complete as possible) when study treatment administration stopped (e.g., for infusions this is the time when the infusion ended).
fields.definition: The end time of treatment represented in an unambiguous time format (e.g., hh:mm:ss).
fields.implementationNotes: Recommend collecting the time a medication was ended when a protocol or data collection scenarios requires it. For infusions, the end time of the infusion is typically needed.
fields.label: Exposure End Time
fields.mappingInstructions: This does not map directly to an SDTMIG variable. For the SDTM submission dataset, concatenate all collected CDASH END DATE and TIME components and populate the SDTMIG variable EXENDTC in ISO 8601 format.
fields.name: EXENTIM
fields.questionText: What was the [intended/actual] [study treatment/dose] end time?

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.0

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor element for field EX.EXDSTXT

fields.completionInstructions: Record the dose or amount of study treatment that was administered to/taken by the subject in the period recorded; from the start date/time to the end date/time inclusive.
fields.definition: Dose per administration.
fields.implementationNotes: Dose or amount taken for single administration of study treatment or per constant dosing interval recorded. Dose must be collected if it cannot be determined via other methods (e.g., from diary data, drug accountability data, protocol etc.). The data collected in this dose text-format field should be mapped to either SDTMIG variable EXDOSE if numeric or EXDOSTXT if text.
fields.label: Exposure Dose Description
fields.mappingInstructions: This does not map directly to an SDTMIG variable. Numeric values map to EXDOSE in SDTM. Non-numeric values (e.g., 200-400) map to EXDOSTXT in SDTM.
fields.name: EXDSTXT
fields.questionText: What was the dose per administration (of study treatment)?

codelist.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for codelist C71620

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.0

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor element for field EX.EXDOSU

fields.completionInstructions: Record the unit of dose or amount taken per period recorded (e.g., ng, mg, mg/kg).
fields.definition: The unit for intended dose per administration for EXDOSE, EXDOSTOT, or EXDOSTXT.
fields.implementationNotes: Unit of dose or amount taken per constant dosing interval recorded. Dose unit must be collected if it cannot be determined via other methods (e.g., from protocol, randomization data). The unit should be pre-printed on the CRF or a field provided on the CRF to capture it. A CDASH Subset Controlled Terminology Codelist Name is available for general dose and volume units.
fields.label: Exposure Dose Unit
fields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading "SDTMIG Target".
fields.name: EXDOSU
fields.questionText: What was the unit for the dose?

codelist.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for codelist C71113

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.0

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor element for field EX.EXDOSFRQ

fields.completionInstructions: Record the frequency the study treatment was administered for a defined period of time.
fields.definition: The number of doses given/administered/taken during a specific interval.
fields.implementationNotes: This may be collected if it cannot be determined from other sources or if there are multiple options. When possible, the options for dose/amount frequency are pre-printed on the CRF. When collected, the recommendation is to collect dosing information in separate fields (e.g., ECDOSE, ECDOSEU, ECDOSFRQ) for specific and consistent data collection and to enable programmatically utilizing these data.
fields.label: Exposure Dosing Frequency per Interval
fields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading "SDTMIG Target".
fields.name: EXDOSFRQ
fields.questionText: What was the frequency of study treatment dosing?

codelist.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for codelist C66729
Version-agnostic anchor resource for codelist C78425

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.0

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor element for field EX.EXROUTE

fields.completionInstructions: Record the route of administration (e.g., IV, ORAL, TRANSDERMAL) or enter the appropriate code from the code list.
fields.definition: The route of administration of the study treatment.
fields.implementationNotes: This may be collected if it cannot be determined via other methods (e.g., from protocol) or if there are multiple options.
fields.label: Exposure Route of Administration
fields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading "SDTMIG Target".
fields.name: EXROUTE
fields.questionText: What was the route of administration (of the study treatment)?

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.0

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor element for field EX.EXDOSRGM

fields.completionInstructions: Record the regimen for the study medication.
fields.definition: The text description of the (intended) schedule or regimen for the Intervention.
fields.implementationNotes: The regimen information may further clarify the dose administration and dose frequency (e.g., TWO WEEKS ON, TWO WEEKS OFF). This may be pre-printed or collected. The sponsor may wish to create a codelist to collect this data consistently.
fields.label: Intended Dose Regimen
fields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading "SDTMIG Target".
fields.name: EXDOSRGM
fields.questionText: What was the intended dose regimen (of the study treatment)?

codelist.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for codelist C66742

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.0

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor element for field EX.EXDOSADJ

fields.completionInstructions: Select either Yes or No to indicate whether there was a change in dosing.
fields.definition: An indication whether or not the dose was adjusted.
fields.implementationNotes: Typically, the intent/purpose of collecting this field is to help with data cleaning and monitoring as it provides a definitive response regarding any dose changes. It provides verification that the associate field on the CRF (EXADJ) was deliberately left blank. However, the sponsor may collect whether the dose was adjusted, without collecting the reason for the change.
fields.label: Dose Adjusted
fields.mappingInstructions: When EXADJ is collected, does not map to an SDTMIG variable. The SDTM Annotated CRF is annotated to indicate that this field is NOT SUBMITTED. When EXADJ is not collected, the sponsor may submit this variable as a SUPPQ.
fields.name: EXDOSADJ
fields.questionText: Was the dose adjusted?

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.0

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor element for field EX.EXADJ

fields.completionInstructions: If there was a change in dosing, record the reason for change.
fields.definition: Description or explanation of why a dose of the study treatment is adjusted.
fields.implementationNotes: Captures reason dose was changed or modified. The reason may be chosen from a sponsor defined list (for example, adverse event, insufficient response, etc.) or entered as free text. May be used for variations from protocol-specified doses, or changes from expected doses.
fields.label: Reason for Dose Adjustment
fields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading "SDTMIG Target".
fields.name: EXADJ
fields.questionText: What was the reason the dose was adjusted (from planned)?

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.0

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor element for field EX.EXITRPD

fields.completionInstructions: Record the duration of treatment interruption.
fields.definition: The duration of the treatment interruption as collected.
fields.implementationNotes: In some situations, the duration of the interruption may be calculated from the administration start and end times recorded elsewhere in the CRF.
fields.label: Exposure Interruption Duration
fields.mappingInstructions: This does not map directly to an SDTMIG variable. This information could be submitted in a SUPPEX dataset as the value of SUPPEX.QVAL where SUPPEX.QNAM = "EXITRP" and SUPPEX.QLABEL="Collected Interruption Duration". Concatenate the collected treatment interruption duration and the duration unit components and create EXINTRP using ISO 8601 Period format. Refer to the current SDTM and SDTMIG for instructions on placement of non-standard variables in SDTM domains.
fields.name: EXITRPD
fields.questionText: If the dose was interrupted, how long was the interruption?

codelist.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for codelist C71620
Version-agnostic anchor resource for codelist C78427

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.0

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor element for field EX.EXITRPDU

fields.completionInstructions: Record the unit (e.g., MINUTES, HOURS, DAYS) for the duration of treatment interruption.
fields.definition: The unit for the duration of treatment interruption.
fields.implementationNotes: The unit should be collected and converted into ISO 8601 period format.
fields.label: Exposure Interruption Duration Units
fields.mappingInstructions: This does not map directly to an SDTMIG variable. This information could be submitted in a SUPPEX dataset as the value of SUPPEX.QVAL where SUPPEX.QNAM = "EXITRP" and SUPPEX.QLABEL="Collected Interruption Duration". Concatenate the collected treatment interruption duration and the duration unit components and create EXINTRP using ISO 8601 Period format. Refer to the current SDTM and SDTMIG for instructions on placement of non-standard variables in SDTM domains.
fields.name: EXITRPDU
fields.questionText: If the dose was interrupted, what were the units for the interruption duration?

codelist.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for codelist C74456

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.0

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor element for field EX.EXLOC

fields.completionInstructions: Record the body location where the study treatment was administered (e.g., SHOULDER, HIP, ARM).
fields.definition: A description of the anatomical location of administration.
fields.implementationNotes: Collected or pre-printed when the sponsor needs to identify the specific anatomical location where the study treatment was administered. LAT, DIR, PORTOT are used to further describe the anatomical location.
fields.label: Exposure Location
fields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading "SDTMIG Target".
fields.name: EXLOC
fields.questionText: What was the anatomical location of the (study treatment) administration?

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.0

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor element for field EX.EXVAMT

fields.completionInstructions: Record the total amount (treatment +vehicle) that was administered/given to the subject.
fields.definition: The amount of the prepared product (treatment + vehicle) administered or given.
fields.implementationNotes: Administration amount that was given to the subject. Note: should not be the diluent amount alone. The ECTRTV field may be collected if it cannot be determined from other sources.
fields.label: Exposure Vehicle Amount
fields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading "SDTMIG Target". The SDTM variable ECTRTV may also be populated during the process of creating the SDTM submission datasets.
fields.name: EXVAMT
fields.questionText: What was the total amount (Drug + Vehicle)(of study treatment) administered?

codelist.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for codelist C71620
Version-agnostic anchor resource for codelist C78428

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.0

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor element for field EX.EXVAMTU

fields.completionInstructions: Record the unit of total amount (treatment +vehicle) administered/given to the subject (e.g., mL).
fields.definition: The unit of measure for the prepared product (treatment + vehicle).
fields.implementationNotes: Unit of the administration amount. A CDASH Subset Controlled Terminology Codelist Name is available for dose and volume units.
fields.label: Exposure Vehicle Amount Units
fields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading "SDTMIG Target".
fields.name: EXVAMTU
fields.questionText: What was the unit for the amount (of study treatment) administered?

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.0

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor element for field EX.EXFLRT

fields.completionInstructions: Record the Rate of Infusion (e.g., if rate is 10 mL/min. Record 10 as the infusion rate).
fields.definition: The flow rate for the total amount of drug + vehicle administered to the subject.
fields.implementationNotes: Infusion rate can be used to derive dose.
fields.label: Exposure Infusion Rate
fields.mappingInstructions: This does not map directly to an SDTMIG variable. This information could be submitted in a SUPPEX dataset as the value of SUPPEX.QVAL where SUPPEX.QNAM = "EXFLRT" and SUPPEX.QLABEL= "Infusion Rate". Refer to the current SDTM and SDTMIG for instructions on placement of non-standard variables in SDTM domains.
fields.name: EXFLRT
fields.questionText: What was the study treatment infusion rate?

codelist.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for codelist C71620
Version-agnostic anchor resource for codelist C78429

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.0

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor element for field EX.EXFLRTU

fields.completionInstructions: Record the unit for the infusion rate (e.g., mL/min).
fields.definition: The unit of measure for the flow rate for the total amount of drug + vehicle administered to the subject.
fields.implementationNotes: Unit of the infusion rate.
fields.label: Exposure Infusion Rate Unit
fields.mappingInstructions: This does not map directly to an SDTMIG variable. This information could be submitted in a SUPPEX dataset as the value of SUPPEX.QVAL where SUPPEX.QNAM ="EXFLRTU" and SUPPEX.QLABEL="Infusion Rate Unit". Refer to the current SDTM and SDTMIG for instructions on placement of non-standard variables in SDTM domains.
fields.name: EXFLRTU
fields.questionText: What were the units for the study treatment infusion rate?

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.0

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor element for field EX.EXTPT

fields.completionInstructions: Record the planned time point of study treatment administration if not pre-printed on the CRF.
fields.definition: A text description of planned time point when measurements should be taken as defined in the protocol.
fields.implementationNotes: Planned time point are needed to differentiate multiple sequential assessments. It is recommended that time points should be pre-printed on the CRF rather than collected in a field that requires the site to enter text. If the form is laid out as a grid, then words such as Planned Time Point can be included as the column header.
fields.label: Exposure Planned Time Point Name
fields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading "SDTMIG Target". See SDTMIG for additional information on representing time points. The SDTMIG time point anchors EXTPTREF (text description) and EXRFTDTC (date/time) may be needed, as well as SDTMIG variables EXTPTNUM, EXELTM.
fields.name: EXTPT
fields.questionText: What was the planned time point for study treatment?

codelist.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for codelist C66742

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.0

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor element for field EX.EXTRTCMP

fields.completionInstructions: Select either Yes or No to indicate whether subject has completed the full course of treatment.
fields.definition: Subject did not did not complete the intended regimen.
fields.implementationNotes: Depending on how the study treatment details are collected via the CRF/ eCRF, it may be possible to derive those data if the regimen data are collected.
fields.label: Completed Treatment
fields.mappingInstructions: This does not map directly to an SDTMIG variable. This information could be submitted in a SUPPEX dataset as the value of SUPPEX.QVAL where SUPPEX.QNAM = "EXTRTCMP" and SUPPEX.QLABEL="Completed Treatment". Refer to the current SDTM and SDTMIG for instructions on placement of non-standard variables in SDTM domains.
fields.name: EXTRTCMP
fields.questionText: Did the subject complete the full course of study treatment?

codelist.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for codelist C99073

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.0

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor element for field EX.EXLAT

fields.completionInstructions: Record the side of the body location where the study treatment was administered (e.g., Left, Right).
fields.definition: Qualifier for anatomical location further detailing side of the body for the study treatment administration.
fields.implementationNotes: Further detailing the laterality of the location where the study treatment was administered. This may be pre-printed or collected. Sponsors may collect the data using a subset list of Controlled Terminology on the CRF.
fields.label: Exposure Laterality
fields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading "SDTMIG Target".
fields.name: EXLAT
fields.questionText: What was the side of the anatomical location of the (study treatment) administration?

codelist.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for codelist C99074

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.0

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor element for field EX.EXDIR

fields.completionInstructions: Record the directionality of the body location where the study treatment was administered (e.g., Anterior, Lower, Proximal, Upper).
fields.definition: Qualifier further detailing the position of the anatomical location relative to the center of the body, organ, or specimen.
fields.implementationNotes: May be pre-printed or collected when the sponsor needs to identify the directionality of the anatomical location. Sponsors may collect the data using a subset list of Controlled Terminology on the CRF.
fields.label: Exposure Directionality
fields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading "SDTMIG Target".
fields.name: EXDIR
fields.questionText: What was the directionality of the anatomical location of the (study treatment) administration?
